intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis cundinamarcae, commonly known as the Cundinamarca orchid, is a species native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is a small, terrestrial orchid with a delicate appearance, featuring slender stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in a spike. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
